source: James Jones (author) . He won the 1952 National Book Award for his first published novel , From Here to Eternity , which was adapted for the big screen immediately and made into a television series a generation later . James Jones (basketball player) . He averaged 25 points per game as a senior , earning Class 6A Player of the Year and First Team All-State honors . He has won three NBA championships , two with the Heat and one with the Cavaliers . In 2017 , he and teammate LeBron James reached the NBA Finals for the seventh consecutive year . He finished third in the NBA in three-point percentage during the 2007 -- 08 season and won the Three-Point Contest in 2011 .
summary: The passage provides information about two individuals named James Jones. The first James Jones is an author who won the 1952 National Book Award for his first novel, "From Here to Eternity," which was later adapted for a movie and a TV series. The second James Jones is a basketball player who has won three NBA championships, two with the Miami Heat and one with the Cleveland Cavaliers. In 2017, he and teammate LeBron James reached the NBA Finals for the seventh consecutive year. He also finished third in the NBA in three-point percentage during the 2007-08 season and won the Three-Point Contest in 2011.
